alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 27 at 3:22PM EDT until September 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of up to 8 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level is expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...The coast of Sussex County, Delaware. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Thursday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8:00 PM this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 1:00 AM Thursday. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion are expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore and into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will remain elevated into the weekend, with minor or near minor tidal flooding possible with the nighttime high tides on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Delaware Bay at Lewes MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 27/08 PM 6.6 2.0 1.3 Minor 28/08 AM 5.9 1.2 1.0 None 28/09 PM 6.6 2.0 1.3 Minor 29/09 AM 6.3 1.7 1.1 Minor 29/09 PM 6.2 1.5 1.0 Minor 30/10 AM 6.6 2.0 1.2 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Conditions in the surf are extremely dangerous. Stay out of the water.
